intro: Anticlea hintoniorum, commonly known as the Hinton's antclea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically palmately lobed, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
